</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Move soldier into vehicle cargo position (Immediate, no animation). </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName [[moveInCargo]] vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> unitName [[moveInCargo]] [vehicle, CargoIndex] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> CargoIndex: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[moveInAny]], [[moveInCommander]], [[moveInDriver]], [[moveInGunner]], [[moveInTurret]], [[assignAsCargo]], [[assignAsCommander]], [[assignAsDriver]], [[assignAsGunner]], [[getCargoIndex]]   </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2006 - 14:42
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]
<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion''<br>
If you place a soldier in a vehicle with the moveInCargo command, he wont "know" he's in the vehicle, and thus he won't disembark properly when the vehicle reaches a Transport Unload waypoint. Therefore you have to use the [[assignAsCargo]] command, in order for the AI to catch on. Something like this: <code>_soldier [[moveInCargo]] helo1; _soldier [[assignAsCargo]] helo1;</code>

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP v1.96''', the moveIn commands will not trigger an associated getIn [[Operation_Flashpoint:_EventHandlers_List|event]]. To ensure the getIn event is fired, use the "getIn Cargo" [[Operation_Flashpoint:_Actions_List|action]] command.

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">
In Arma 3 when using the alternative syntax of [[moveInCargo]], it is necessary to call [[assignAsCargoIndex]] because it is not called automatically.
<code>unit1 [[moveInCargo]] [heli, 3];
unit1 [[assignAsCargoIndex]] [heli, 3];</code>
Alternatively avoid this broken syntax all together and use:
<code>unit1 [[assignAsCargoIndex]] [heli, 3];
unit1 [[moveInCargo]] heli;
</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>
